Quickstride keeps his nose, ears and eyes open for signs of trouble.  Somet=
hing definitely made him uneasy, yet he could not put his hoof on it.

"I c=
opy you on that Rodimus... I can't figure it out but something is making th=
e mane on my neck stand on end..  Sorta like a horsefly ya can't shake off.=
.."

Tucson acknowledges Rodimus quickly.

" Thank you for the intel Rodimu=
s.  Now I will be able to keep my sensors open for any wave disturbances.  =
Ususally my sonar systems only pick up on solid objects, but there is a cha=
nce that fluxuations in energy waves, can be detected via echolocation.  My=
 systems are up and running now..  But there's one flaw, that kind of detec=
tion system is short range.  If there's any disturbances long range, I will=
 not be able to detect them.  I will do the best I can to keep alert."

He =
rolls on with caution, trying not to kick up any dirt, or disturb anything =
around him.  As tires roll over uneven ground his trailer rocks slightly as=
 he tries hard to avoid too much movement from it.
